EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Please see below instructions on how to unlock Apple iPhones, either for your records, or should you need to distribute to your end users:
After receiving confirmation from the unlocking department that your Apple iPhone unlock has been processed, you will need to perform one of the following to complete the unlock process
If you have an active non-Rogers SIM card:
Turn off your iPhone. Remove your Rogers SIM card from the iPhone.
Eject the SIM tray by inserting the SIM tool that came with your iPhone into the tiny hole next to the tray.
Insert the non-Rogers SIM card back into the iPhone. Turn on the device, and complete the onscreen setup process.
If you only have an active Rogers SIM card:
Back up your iPhone through Apple iCloud or Apple iTunes.
iCloud:
Tap Settings >iCloud >Storage & Backup > Back Up Now.
iTunes:
Click File > Devices > Back up.
Transfer your purchases to the computer. iTunes:
Click File > Transfer Purchases from your device name.
Restore your iPhone through Apple iTunes or on your iPhone.
iTunes:
Click Summary > Restore iPhone > Restore .
iPhone:
Tap Settings > General > Reset >Erase all Content and Settings. Connect the iPhone to the computer and launch iTunes
Note: You should be prompted with a message stating your iPhone is now unlocked. Restore your contents from the back up file after the unlock process.
